Kominfo Bakal Bikin Komisi Khusus Perlindungan Data Pribadi
06 Nov 2019, 04:40 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi internet. (Pixabay.com)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informatika (Kemenkominfo) menyebut bakal mengikuti jejak Singapura untuk membuat suatu komisi yang mengurusi aturan perlindungan data pribadi.Di Singapura, komisi itu bernama Personal Data Protection Comission (PDPC) yang dibentuk sejak 2013."Saat ini masih dibahas tapi kita akan mengikuti modelnya Singapura. Jadi bukan badan baru tetapi komisi, nantinya mereka bekerja secara independen tetapi secara struktural di bawah Kemenkominfo," kata Dirjen Aplikasi Informatika Semuel Abrijani Pangerapan kepada awak media usai acara Kompas 100 CEO Forum di Jakarta, Selasa (5/11).Sebelum merujuk ke Singapura, Kemenkominfo juga sempat mengkaji General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), sebuah badan yang dibentuk oleh Uni Eropa untuk menangani aturan perlindungan data. Tujuan kajian mencari kecocokan untuk diimplementasikan di Indonesia."Sebetulnya kita sempat mengkaji GDPR, apakah kita bisa mencontoh badan itu atau tidak. GDPR kan independen dan dibuat oleh parlemen, tetapi yang penting buat kita adalah ada otoritas yang bisa kita awasi," pungkas Semuel.Sebelumnya, Deputi Direktur Riset Lembaga Studi dan Advokasi Masyarakat (ELSAM) Wahyudi Djafar mendorong terbentuknya lembaga non pemerintah atau independen untuk mengendalikan, mengumpulkan, dan mengawasi data pribadi masyarakat.Menurutnya, keberadaan badan pengawas independen menjadi elemen penting implementasi Undang-undang Perlindungan Data Pribadi (PDP)."Kami mendorong agar ada lembaga independen atau lembaga pengawas independen saat implementasi Undang-undang Perlindungan Data Pribadi. Sebab kalau ini [UU PDP] diserahkan ke pemerintah sementara pemerintah juga diposisi sebagai pengendali dan pemroses data itu kan kayak jeruk makan jeruk," kata Wahyudi pada Senin, 15 Juli 2019.Berkaca pada negara lain, Wahyudi mengatakan lembaga pengawas independen juga dilengkapi mandat untuk melakukan investigasi, menerima, dan merespons aduan, memberikan saran, dan langkah-langkah untuk meningkatkan kesadaran publik terhadap perlindungan data pribadi mereka.Nantinya lembaga pengawas akan menjatuhkan sanksi apabila ada penyahgunaan data pribadi dan mengeluarkan rekomendasi serta panduan. (din/fea)

Kominfo Will Make A Special Commission For Personal Data Protection
Nov 6 2019, 04:40 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Internet illustration. (Pixabay.com)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The Ministry of Communication and Information Technology (Kemenkominfo) said it would follow in Singapore's footsteps to create a commission that deals with personal data protection rules. In Singapore, the commission was named the Personal Data Protection Commission (PDPC), which was formed in 2013. "Currently "We are still discussing it but we will follow the Singapore model. So it is not a new body but a commission, later they will work independently but structurally under the Ministry of Communication and Information," Director General of Informatics Applications Semuel Abrijani Pangerapan told media crews after the Kompas 100 CEO Forum event in Jakarta, Tuesday ( 5/11). Before referring to Singapore, the Ministry of Communication and Information also briefly reviewed the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), a body formed by the European Union to handle data protection rules. The purpose of the study is to find a match to be implemented in Indonesia. "Actually, we had a chance to study GDPR, whether we can imitate the body or not. GDPR is independent and made by the parliament, but what is important for us is that there is authority that we can oversee," concluded Semuel. Previously, Deputy Research Director of the Institute for Community Study and Advocacy (ELSAM) Wahyudi Djafar encouraged the formation of non-governmental or independent institutions to control, collect, and supervise public personal data. According to him, the existence of an independent supervisory body became an important element in the implementation of the Personal Data Protection Act ( "We encourage that there be an independent institution or an independent supervisory body when implementing the Personal Data Protection Act. Because if this [PDP Law] is submitted to the government while the government is also positioned as the controller and processor of the data it is like oranges eating oranges," Wahyudi said on Monday, July 15, 2019. Read to the state a, Wahyudi said that an independent monitoring agency was also equipped with a mandate to investigate, receive, and respond to complaints, provide advice, and steps to increase public awareness of the protection of their personal data. Later the supervisory agency would impose sanctions if there was a misuse of personal data and issuing recommendations and guidelines. (din / fea)
